nodes.id: 中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明
en: Joint Communiqué of the Government of Japan and the Government of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 1972年9月29日由中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府签署的联合声明，标志着两国建立外交关系。
description.en: A joint statement signed by the Government of the People's Republic of China and the Government of Japan on September 29, 1972, marking the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家、军事家、外交家，时任中华人民共和国国务院总理，代表中方签署了《中日联合声明》。
description.en: Chinese statesman, military leader, and diplomat, then Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, who signed the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué on behalf of the Chinese side.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物、外交官，时任中华人民共和国外交部部长，代表中方签署了《中日联合声明》。
description.en: Chinese politician and diplomat, then Minister of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China, who signed the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué on behalf of the Chinese side.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，时任日本内阁总理大臣，代表日方签署了《中日联合声明》。
description.en: Japanese politician, then Prime Minister of Japan, who signed the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué on behalf of the Japanese side.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，时任日本外务大臣，代表日方签署了《中日联合声明》。
description.en: Japanese politician, then Minister for Foreign Affairs of Japan, who signed the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué on behalf of the Japanese side.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家、政治家、理论家，时任中国共产党中央委员会主席，在中日建交谈判期间会见了日方代表团。
description.en: Chinese communist revolutionary, political theorist and founding father of the People's Republic of China, then Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, who met with the Japanese delegation during the negotiations for the establishment of diplomatic relations.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，时任内阁官房长官，陪同田中角荣访华。
description.en: Japanese politician, then Chief Cabinet Secretary, who accompanied Kakuei Tanaka on his visit to China.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治家，第37任美国总统。其于1972年访华，推动了中美关系正常化，也为中日建交创造了条件。
description.en: American politician who served as the 37th president of the United States. His 1972 visit to China promoted the normalization of Sino-US relations and created conditions for the establishment of Sino-Japanese diplomatic relations.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，属于亲中华民国派，在1972年日本自由民主党总裁选举中被田中角荣击败。
description.en: Japanese politician, belonging to the pro-Republic of China faction, who was defeated by Kakuei Tanaka in the 1972 Liberal Democratic Party presidential election.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，在1972年自民党总裁选举中支持田中角荣实现中日邦交正常化的承诺。
description.en: Japanese politician who supported Kakuei Tanaka's commitment to normalize Japan-China diplomatic relations in the 1972 LDP presidential election.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，在1972年自民党总裁选举中支持田中角荣实现中日邦交正常化的承诺。
description.en: Japanese politician who supported Kakuei Tanaka's commitment to normalize Japan-China diplomatic relations in the 1972 LDP presidential election.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，其领导的内阁在2025年3月表示《中日联合声明》不具有法律约束力。
description.en: Japanese politician whose cabinet stated in March 2025 that the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué is not legally binding.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国外交官，作为外交部发言人回应了日方关于《中日联合声明》法律约束力的说法。
description.en: Chinese diplomat who, as a spokesperson for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, responded to Japan's claims regarding the legal binding force of the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué.

description.zh-cn: 东亚国家，1972年与日本建立外交关系。
description.en: An East Asian country that established diplomatic relations with Japan in 1972.

description.zh-cn: 东亚国家，1972年与中华人民共和国建立外交关系。
description.en: An East Asian country that established diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1972.

en: Government of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的中央行政机关，是签署《中日联合声明》的一方。
description.en: The central administrative organ of the People's Republic of China, a signatory to the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué.

description.zh-cn: 日本国的中央行政机关，是签署《中日联合声明》的一方。
description.en: The central administrative organ of Japan, a signatory to the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué.

description.zh-cn: 欧亚大陆北部的社会主义国家。1960年代后与中国关系恶化，对中国构成安全威胁，促使中国寻求与西方国家缓和关系。
description.en: A socialist state in northern Eurasia. After the 1960s, its relations with China deteriorated, posing a security threat to China and prompting China to seek détente with Western countries.

description.zh-cn: 北美洲国家。其在1970年代对华战略的转变为中日建交创造了条件。
description.en: A North American country. Its strategic shift towards China in the 1970s created the conditions for the establishment of Sino-Japanese diplomatic relations.

description.zh-cn: 1949年后退守台湾的政权。在中日建交后，日本与其断交。
description.en: The regime that retreated to Taiwan after 1949. Japan severed diplomatic relations with it after establishing relations with the PRC.

en: Government of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的中央行政机关。在《中日联合声明》中，日本承认中华人民共和国政府为中国唯一合法政府，间接否定了中华民国政府的合法性。
description.en: The central administrative organ of the Republic of China. In the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué, Japan recognized the government of the PRC as the sole legal government of China, indirectly denying the legitimacy of the ROC government.

description.zh-cn: 日本的主要政党之一，田中角荣通过赢得其总裁选举而出任首相，并推动了中日建交。
description.en: One of Japan's major political parties. Kakuei Tanaka became Prime Minister by winning its presidential election and promoted the normalization of Japan-China relations.

nodes.id: 中国共产党中央委员会

zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会
en: Central Committee of the Communist Party of China

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的中央领导机构，时任主席毛泽东参与了中日建交的决策过程。
description.en: The central leading body of the Communist Party of China. Its then-Chairman, Mao Zedong, was involved in the decision-making process for the normalization of Japan-China relations.

description.zh-cn: 由石破茂领导的日本内阁。该内阁在2025年3月通过答辩书，表示《中日联合声明》不具有法律约束力。
description.en: The Cabinet of Japan led by Shigeru Ishiba. In March 2025, this cabinet issued a written response stating that the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué is not legally binding.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国外交部

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国外交部
en: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国负责外交事务的政府部门。
description.en: The government department of the People's Republic of China responsible for foreign affairs.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国与苏联之间的一段政治关系紧张时期，是促使中国寻求与日本建交的背景之一。
description.en: A period of tense political relations between the People's Republic of China and the Soviet Union, which was one of the background factors that prompted China to seek the establishment of diplomatic relations with Japan.

description.zh-cn: 1969年中华人民共和国与苏联之间的一系列武装冲突，加剧了中国面临的安全威胁，促使其调整外交战略。
description.en: A series of armed clashes between the People's Republic of China and the Soviet Union in 1969, which intensified the security threat faced by China and prompted it to adjust its foreign policy strategy.

en: 1972 visit by Richard Nixon to China

description.zh-cn: 时任美国总统理查德·尼克松对中华人民共和国的访问，是中美关系正常化的重要一步，也为中日关系正常化创造了条件。
description.en: The visit of then-U.S. President Richard Nixon to the People's Republic of China, an important step in the normalization of Sino-U.S. relations, which also created conditions for the normalization of Sino-Japanese relations.

description.zh-cn: 联合国大会于1971年通过的决议，承认中华人民共和国政府是中国的唯一合法代表。此事件是中日建交的背景之一。
description.en: A resolution passed by the United Nations General Assembly in 1971, recognizing the Government of the People's Republic of China as the sole legitimate representative of China. This event was part of the background to the establishment of Sino-Japanese diplomatic relations.

description.zh-cn: 中美两国在1972年尼克松访华后发表的联合公报，震惊世界，并影响了日本对华政策的转变。
description.en: A joint communiqué issued by China and the United States after Nixon's 1972 visit, which shocked the world and influenced the shift in Japan's policy towards China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国与日本在1952年签订的和平条约，在《中日联合声明》签署后，被日本方面宣布失效。
description.en: A peace treaty signed between the Republic of China and Japan in 1952, which was declared null and void by the Japanese side after the signing of the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué.

description.zh-cn: 同盟国在1945年发表的公告，规定了日本投降的条款。《中日联合声明》中，日本政府表示坚持遵循该公告第八条的立场。
description.en: A declaration issued by the Allied Powers in 1945, which defined the terms for Japanese surrender. In the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué, the Japanese government stated its adherence to the position of Article 8 of this declaration.

en: Treaty of Peace and Friendship between Japan and China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国与日本于1978年签订的条约，从法律上确认了《中日联合声明》的各项原则。
description.en: A treaty signed between the People's Republic of China and Japan in 1978, which legally confirmed the principles of the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国北京的建筑，《中日联合声明》在此签署。
description.en: A building in Beijing, China, where the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué was signed.

description.zh-cn: 东亚岛屿。《中日联合声明》中涉及其政治地位问题，中华人民共和国政府重申其为中国领土，日本政府对此表示充分理解和尊重。
description.en: An island in East Asia. Its political status was addressed in the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué, in which the PRC government reiterated that it is a part of China's territory, and the Japanese government expressed its full understanding and respect for this position.

description.zh-cn: 作为中方代表签署了《中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明》。
description.en: Signed the Joint Communiqué of the Government of the People's Republic of China and the Government of Japan as a representative of the Chinese side.

description.en: Signed the Joint Communiqué of the Government of the People's Republic of China and the Government of Japan as a representative of the Chinese side.

description.zh-cn: 作为日方代表签署了《中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明》。
description.en: Signed the Joint Communiqué of the Government of the People's Republic of China and the Government of Japan as a representative of the Japanese side.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明

description.zh-cn: 作为日方代表签署了《中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明》。
description.en: Signed the Joint Communiqué of the Government of the People's Republic of China and the Government of Japan as a representative of the Japanese side.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明

description.zh-cn: 中苏关系恶化及苏联带来的安全威胁，是促使中国寻求与日本及西方国家改善关系的战略背景之一。
description.en: The deterioration of Sino-Soviet relations and the security threat posed by the Soviet Union were part of the strategic background that prompted China to seek improved relations with Japan and Western countries.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明

description.zh-cn: 美国对华战略的转变，以尼克松访华为标志，为日本调整其对华政策并与中国建交创造了国际环境。
description.en: The shift in U.S. strategy towards China, marked by Nixon's visit, created the international environment for Japan to adjust its China policy and establish diplomatic relations.

description.zh-cn: 1972年9月，日本首相田中角荣访华期间会见了中共中央主席毛泽东。
description.en: In September 1972, Japanese Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka met with CPC Central Committee Chairman Mao Zedong during his visit to China.

description.zh-cn: 1972年9月，日本首相田中角荣访华期间与中国总理周恩来举行会谈，商讨建交事宜。
description.en: In September 1972, Japanese Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka held talks with Chinese Premier Zhou Enlai during his visit to China to discuss the establishment of diplomatic relations.

description.zh-cn: 自1960年代中苏交恶后，两国关系严重对立，甚至在1969年爆发边界战争，苏联对中国构成严重的安全威胁。
description.en: Since the Sino-Soviet split in the 1960s, relations between the two countries were severely antagonistic, even leading to a border war in 1969, with the Soviet Union posing a serious security threat to China.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明

description.zh-cn: 《中日联合声明》签署后，日本外相大平正芳宣布，日本与中华民国之间订立的《中日和约》失去存在的意义而宣告终结。
description.en: After the signing of the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué, Japanese Foreign Minister Masayoshi Ōhira announced that the Treaty of Peace between Japan and the Republic of China had lost its significance and was terminated.

description.zh-cn: 通过签署《中日联合声明》，日本国政府承认中华人民共和国政府是中国的唯一合法政府，从而与中华民国政府断绝了外交关系。
description.en: By signing the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué, the Government of Japan recognized the Government of the People's Republic of China as the sole legal government of China, thereby severing diplomatic relations with the Government of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 在1972年日本自由民主党总裁选举中，三木武夫支持田中角荣实现与中华人民共和国邦交正常化的承诺。
description.en: In the 1972 Liberal Democratic Party presidential election, Takeo Miki supported Kakuei Tanaka's commitment to normalizing diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 在1972年日本自由民主党总裁选举中，中曾根康弘支持田中角荣实现与中华人民共和国邦交正常化的承诺。
description.en: In the 1972 Liberal Democratic Party presidential election, Yasuhiro Nakasone supported Kakuei Tanaka's commitment to normalizing diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 在1972年日本自由民主党总裁选举中，田中角荣击败了其最大的竞争对手、属于亲中华民国派的福田赳夫。
description.en: In the 1972 Liberal Democratic Party presidential election, Kakuei Tanaka defeated his biggest competitor, Takeo Fukuda, who belonged to the pro-Republic of China faction.

description.zh-cn: 在《中日联合声明》中，日本政府声明其将坚持遵循《波茨坦公告》第八条的立场，该条款涉及日本领土范围。
description.en: In the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué, the Japanese government stated its adherence to the position of Article 8 of the Potsdam Declaration, which relates to the extent of Japanese territory.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明

description.zh-cn: 2025年3月11日，石破茂内阁作出答辩书并经内阁会议决定，表示《中日联合声明》“不具有法律约束力”。
description.en: On March 11, 2025, the Shigeru Ishiba Cabinet issued a written response, decided by a cabinet meeting, stating that the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué 'does not have legal binding force'.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国外交部
relationships.target: 中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明

description.zh-cn: 针对日方说法，中国外交部回应称，《中日联合声明》的原则已由《中日和平友好条约》从法律上确认，当然具有法律约束力。
description.en: In response to the Japanese side's statement, the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs responded that the principles of the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué were legally confirmed by the Treaty of Peace and Friendship between Japan and China and are therefore legally binding.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国政府和日本国政府联合声明

description.zh-cn: 1978年签订的《中日和平友好条约》在法律上确认了《中日联合声明》是两国和平友好关系的基础，且声明所表明的各项原则应予严格遵守。
description.en: The 1978 Treaty of Peace and Friendship between Japan and China legally confirmed that the Sino-Japanese Joint Communiqué is the foundation of the peaceful and friendly relations between the two countries, and that the principles outlined in the communiqué should be strictly observed.
